intro: Caprifolium bracteolare, commonly known as the bracteolate honeysuckle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is characterized by its fragrant, tubular flowers that typically bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and its stems are often hairy. It thrives in woodland or shaded areas, preferring moist, well-drained soil. Caprifolium bracteolare is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and showy flowers.
